page.title: 01 General description
page.content: The area consists largely of the Medway estuary and its tidal creeks and marshes.The main shore line of the estuary runs from north west to south east along the southern edge of the block. Motney Hill and Horrid Hill are two peninsulas jutting northwards into Bartlett Creek, one of the arms of the estuary.Otterham Creek is an important inlet providing tidal small port facilities. The block also contains much of Nore Marsh,a series of islands and saltings in the estuary itself. Nore Marsh can just be reached on foot by causeway at low tide and was used for grazing until 1950. The highest point in the area is Motney Hill which rises 15m above sea level.Everywhere else is very low-lying and liable to flooding. Land quality has been extensively damaged by salination resulting from heavy flooding in 1963.
